description:
A collection of Extensions and helpful classes/functions. Subject to change/growth. Eg. * IsEven for all number types * Shuffle for arrays and IEnumerable (recursive shuffle, so may fail on very large lists) * IsLower, IsNumeric, ToUpper, ToLower etc for char type * FirstWord, LastWord, Capitalize, etc for string, * Recursive file finder based on the path of a parent directory * Read number from Console. Keep prompting until correct * Write colored lines etc to console. * Read while not flag (eg '#') for flag controlled while loop * simple methods for building HTML strings eg. P("Hello world", "hello") will build

Hello world

, supports class and style. This is pretty simple, I just needed something basic, so it's not very fancy and never will be. And many more.
releaseNotes:
Added an implementation of the Trie data structure for efficent string lookups by prefix eg predictive text.
Trie<T> acts much like a Dictionary<string, T> which TrieSet works more like a HashSet and is simply for storing strings. To be honest, HashSet is likely faster for most things. HashSet is very fast! But there are a few times where Trie may be more useful.
Replaced lemmatization with a trie version which should be faster and more accurate.
Moved Graph to Collections.
Slight changes to Array Init to allow any starting point, and any any step size
A couple of little one liner Extension methods for converting between number types and booleans, and back.
A Color struct. Stores color as 3 byte values, but provides a number of properties for color data such as hex value, hue, saturation, value, luminosity. Can be initialized by rgb or by hex value string.
Unsafe int swap is removed, so there is now no unsife code. The same functionality can be achieved now with CBTools.Extensions.Numbers.NumberTools.RefTempSwap(ref int, ref int), or more generally with CBTools.Tools.RefSwap<T>(ref T, ref T). Be careful when using these if you don't understand the ref keyword. They can act in unnusual ways.
